summary: Introduced by Rep. Greene of Georgia, H.R. 276, the "Gulf of America Act of 2025," proposes to officially rename the Gulf of Mexico as the Gulf of America. The bill mandates that any reference to the Gulf of Mexico in U.S. laws, maps, regulations, or other official records be legally considered a reference to the Gulf of America. It directs the Secretary of the Interior, acting through the U.S. Board on Geographic Names, to oversee this change. All federal agencies would be required to update their documents and maps accordingly within 180 days of the bill's enactment.
